headline: Alphawave Stock Soars in London as Qualcomm Reportedly Mulls Takeover Offer
summary: Shares of U.K.-based semiconductor firm Alphawave surged in London following reports Qualcomm is considering making an offer to buy the company.

headline: Qualcomm acquires generative AI division of Vietnamese startup VinAI
summary: Qualcomm has acquired the generative AI division of VinAI, an AI research company headquartered in Hanoi, for an undisclosed amount, the companies announced on Monday. The move marks Qualcomm's continued expansion into the AI tooling sector. VinAI, which was founded by former DeepMind research scientist Hung Bui, develops a range of generative AI technologies, including computer vision algorithms and language models. headline: United Microelectronics (UMC) Surges 9.2%: Is This an Indication of Further Gains?

headline: Qualcomm considers buying UK semiconductor firm Alphawave
summary: Its 'serdes' technology determines how fast information can be processed by chips - crucial for AI development - and serves as the foundation for Broadcom and Marvell Technology's multibillion-dollar bespoke chip businesses.  Alphawave's shares soared by more than half to a high of 142.9 pence, valuing it at 708.2 million pounds ($913.1 million), according to LSEG data.  Qualcomm did not respond to a Reuters request for further details of a potential deal, while Alphawave did not comment.
